channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report E-2024090464
item.description:
Report E-2024090464

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-17
  • City: LITHONIA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On September 17, 2024, at 1141 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Lithonia, Georgia regarding the release of NALCOÂ® BT-3011 BOILER WATER TREATMENT. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 260 gallons of Nalco BT-3011 Boiler Water Treatment (Sodium Hydroxide Solution, UN1824, 8, III) from (1) IBC plastic tote. The release was caused by a puncture and impacted the trailer floor, and multiple small areas of concrete as the trailer was in motion, that were unrecoverable. The residual material in the damaged tote was neutralized and solidified with absorbents, the damaged tote was cut up, then the trailer was neutralized and cleaned. Contractors also confirmed a 1ft x 6inch area of soil was impacted. Contractors were able to collect the impacted soil without complication. All waste was containerized in (4) 55-gallon DFs and taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024090446
item.description:
Report E-2024090446

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-29
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 17000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: At 23:00 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal NNA. It was reported that approximately 137.5 gallons of UN3266 Natural HDPE FCL13 released from a plastic tote due to a pole on another piece of freight puncturing the tote during the unloading process. The release impacted inside of trailer #3153521 and asphalt. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 180-gallons of product released to a 300-yard x 400-yard are of the asphalt lot as well as the trailer floor. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The remaining material in the tote was transferred into a new one. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized. All impacted absorbents and the cut up poly tote were then containerized into (3) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090416
item.description:
Report E-2024090416

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-06

  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PITT OHIO EXPRESS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: During the process of loading freight into the trailer where the tote was already loaded, a protruding piece of wood from a broken pallet punctured the tote. The IBC container was immediately contained to reduce further release. The released material was neutralized, absorbed and containerized for proper disposal.

UN3378, Sodium Carbonate Peroxyhydrate, 5.1, PGII, paper bag specs 5M2/Y27.0/S?23/USA+BR11981, 5-55Ib bags spilled totaling 27 lbs.

item.title: Report X-2024070285
item.description:
Report X-2024070285

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-21T00:40:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-17
  • City: MCRAE
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 45
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 50000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Car was found releasing vapor as it went through Beebe, AR and was stopped by the local FD outside McRae, AR. The FD conducted a 1/2-mile evacuation and isolated the area. Upon HMM arrival, we met with the FD and was granted approval to access the car. Upon inspection of the car, liquid was observed releasing from under the valve at the connection of the 4-bolt valve flange to the flanged riser due to all four nuts that secure the valve to the flange not secured. The four nuts were found inside the protective housing. The pressure was removed from the car, the leak stopped, and the four bolts properly secured. The car was neutralized and set out. An OTMA-1 was granted for movement back to the shipper.

item.title: Report E-2024090368
item.description:
Report E-2024090368

  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was pumping out the customer's storage tank and overfilled the tank trailer. This resulted in approximately 250 gallons of gasoline being released. Miller Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report E-2024090296
item.description:
Report E-2024090296

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-13
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG SPECIALTY PRODUCTS GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Specialty Products Group, LLC driver failed to properly secure the loading lines at the shipper location. As a result, approximately 1300 pounds of molten sulfur was released. Hepaco Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.
